*[Bug 18772] New: In "Writing R Extensions" Sec 1.1.1, show how to include an ORCID number*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18772>

            Bug ID: 18772
           Summary: In "Writing R Extensions" Sec 1.1.1, show how to
                    include an ORCID number
           Product: R
           Version: R 4.4.x
          Hardware: All
                OS: All
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: enhancement
          Priority: P5
         Component: Documentation
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:d.firth@warwick.ac.uk|d.firth@warwick.ac.uk>

This suggestion is prompted by something I heard in Kurt Hornik's recent useR!
2024 talk, namely that supplying ORCID information in package DESCRIPTION files
is encouraged.  The same is currently encouraged also at
<https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/submission_checklist.html> 

My minimal suggestion: add a `comment = c(ORCID = "nnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnn")` field
to at least one of the person identifiers shown in the example DESCRIPTION file
at the top of Section 1.1.1.

Possibly also add a remark to the text of Sec 1.1.1? (along the lines that
ORCID data, where available, is encouraged for CRAN package submissions)

*[Bug 18773] New: grid::dataViewport() has minor bugs in error messages and help*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18773>

            Bug ID: 18773
           Summary: grid::dataViewport() has minor bugs in error messages
                    and help
           Product: R
           Version: R 4.4.x
          Hardware: All
                OS: All
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: minor
          Priority: P5
         Component: Graphics
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:d.firth@warwick.ac.uk|d.firth@warwick.ac.uk>

The code for `grid::dataViewport()` includes argument-checking error messages,
```
stop("must specify at least one of 'x' or 'xscale'")
```
and
```
stop("must specify at least one of 'y' or 'yscale'")
```

It should be `'xData'` and `'yData'` instead of `'x'` and `'y'`, if I am
understanding things correctly.

There is a corresponding error in the *Details* section of the help page for
`dataViewport()`: it should read "...the values in 'xData' are used to generate
an x-scale based on the range of 'xData'...".

*[Bug 18774] New: HDF5 library does not have FORTRAN support*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18774>

            Bug ID: 18774
           Summary: HDF5 library does not have FORTRAN support
           Product: Rtools
           Version: 4.3
          Hardware: All
                OS: Windows 64-bit
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Toolchain and libraries
          Assignee: <mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>
          Reporter: <mailto:caiohamamura@gmail.com|caiohamamura@gmail.com>

The HDF5 library that is included within `rtools 4.4` does not have support for
Fortran. It is strange because the default `mingw-w64-ucrt-x86_64-hdf5`
available within MSYS pacman already includes support for Fortran.

Some of my codes do use HDF5 Fortran, would it be possible to include that in a
new version or patch of the rtools?
